p: Both species are closely related and may share very similar morphology, except the leaf shape, which is the main determinative feature, according to many identification keys [ 1, 8, 16]. Numerous publications also inform that the characters of the inflorescence, flower, and seeds are similar in both species and they only differ in leaf shape [ 17, 18, 19]. The leaf shape is not a reliable determination feature though, as it is very variable within the species, especially in S. yangii.
